page.title: 15BEACH POLLUTION/SEA DEFENCES
page.content: The sandy beach is sometimes spoilt by litter left by tourists. I've found cans, bottles and leftover food which the seagulls scavange. Washed up on the beach are oil cans,rags,detergent bottles .Tiny oil or tar stains are sometimes found.A dead sheep was once washed up. In the summer the beach near the sea defences gets full of litter but in winter the beaches are clean. The sea defences are built out of reinforced concrete and are about 6 metres high at Chapel Point.They are built in steps and curve at the top at headland areas.The groynes are made of wood and the sections are bolted together.The groynes are eroding. Overall,our beach is fairly free from pollution.
